entries.title: ‘OPEC does not control the price’: OPEC President
entries.description: OPEC chief talks about output cuts, price volatility, and Russia's war in Ukraine and its effect on oil prices.

entries.title: Florida governor backs ban on diversity lessons in state colleges
entries.description: Republican Ron DeSantis, a possible US presidential candidate, says diversity programmes serve as a 'political filter'.

entries.title: Winter chill brings power outages and travel issues to US south
entries.description: Winter weather has resulted in at least two deaths in the state of Texas and more than 1,600 flight cancellations.

entries.title: Pakistan mosque bombing survivors traumatised but undeterred
entries.description: At least 100 people killed and more than 225 wounded in a suicide attack in the northwestern Pakistani city.

entries.title: Pope slams foreign plundering of Africa as he arrives in DR Congo
entries.description: The 86-year-old Francis says a 'forgotten genocide' is under way in DRC as he begins his trip to two African nations.

entries.title: How much of a security threat is the Pakistani Taliban?
entries.description: Armed group blamed for killing dozens of people in an attack on a mosque in Peshawar.

entries.title: California shooting underscores strain on state’s farmworkers
entries.description: The state's agricultural workforce has long struggled with low wages and vulnerability stemming from immigration status.

entries.title: Pakistan’s security challenges necessitate a new approach
entries.description: Amid multiple crises, Pakistan needs an orderly, democratic transition to re-establish stability and security.

entries.title: India’s budget for new financial year to be in tough constraints
entries.description: Tapering growth, untamed inflation, and a need to be pro-welfare in run-up to elections will shape Modi's budget.

entries.title: Blinken criticises settlements but stresses US support for Israel
entries.description: After meeting Palestinian President Abbas, top US diplomat says Washington's immediate priority is to defuse tensions.

entries.title: Tens of thousands march across France against pension reform
entries.description: Protests, strikes held nearly two weeks after more than one million people protested against raising the retirement age.

entries.title: Russia claims village near embattled Ukrainian city of Bakhmut
entries.description: Defence ministry says Blahodatne captured with help of aerial support; no immediate comment by Ukraine.

entries.title: US states propose Colorado River cuts, California lone holdout
entries.description: Authorities in US West are in talks to cut water use as Colorado River faces historically low levels amid drought.

entries.title: UN experts urge probe into possible war crimes in Mali by Wagner
entries.description: Western powers accuse Malian military, Russian mercenaries of crimes against humanity during fight against insecurity.

entries.title: Green comet expected to be visible for first time in 50 millennia
entries.description: Green-hued comet C/2022 E3 (ZTF) is visible with binoculars, telescopes - and in some areas, the naked eye.

entries.title: UK gov’t facing High Court battle over arms sales to Saudi Arabia
entries.description: The Campaign Against Arms Trade group says the weapons exports have contributed to the deaths of thousands of civilians.

entries.title: Palestinians in Khan al-Ahmar stand ground amid displacement plan
entries.description: The village's years-long legal battle with Israeli authorities for its survival has captured international attention.

entries.title: Conflict in Niger leaves children in limbo
entries.description: Forty percent of Nigerien children are not registered with government after birth due to the cost and time of paperwork.

entries.title: Brazil: Lula, Pele and Riots
entries.description: “I've never seen such political turmoil.”

entries.title: Map: Which countries has Pope Francis visited?
entries.description: Pope Francis' trip to the DRC is the first papal visit since John Paul II travelled there in 1985.

entries.title: Torture leaves Bahrain inmates with long-lasting ‘wounds’: Report
entries.description: ADHRB says 'invisible wounds' are preventing political prisoners from resuming a normal life after arrest.

entries.title: Uzbekistan jails protesters over anti-government unrest
entries.description: Court sentences 22 people to various prison terms over last year's unrest which left 21 people dead.

entries.title: F-16s would give Ukraine an advantage, but risk escalation
entries.description: Experts say the fighter jets are at their best with radar support, and Kyiv would need advanced Western missiles.

entries.title: HRW urges Ukraine to probe its military’s use of banned mines
entries.description: HRW says Ukrainian forces 'extensively' scattered antipersonnel mines in Izyum, causing civilian casualties.

entries.title: Musicians fleeing Russia find a new audience in Georgia
entries.description: Tbilisi was a popular destination for Russians, many of them young men, who left the country to avoid being drafted.

entries.title: Australian nuclear agency joins hunt for lost radioactive capsule
entries.description: People told to stay clear of the tiny capsule containing Caesium-137, which emits radiation equal to 10 X-rays per hour.

entries.title: Why did England veto a Scottish gender reform bill?
entries.description: By vetoing the bill, the Conservative government in London exercised 'muscular unionism'.

entries.title: Rescue operation continues after Pakistan blast that killed 92
entries.description: Most of those killed in a suicide bombing at a Peshawar mosque were police, 52 injured people remain in hospital.

entries.title: Rhino poaching surges 93 percent in Namibia
entries.description: Authorities say 87 rhinos were killed last year compared with 45 in 2021, most poached from the country's largest park.

entries.title: Are COVID travel curbs on China making the world safer?
entries.description: They will not affect global infection numbers or new variant spread but might be pushing an opaque China to open up.

entries.title: Biden administration to end COVID public health emergency in May
entries.description: Move would restructure federal response to treat virus as endemic public health threat, ending some government support.

entries.title: NATO chief Stoltenberg calls for stronger partnership with Japan
entries.description: The NATO secretary-general said the security concerns of the military alliance and Japan are 'closely interconnected'.

entries.title: What’s next in the battle over Atlanta’s ‘Cop City’?
entries.description: Activists and community leaders resist construction of multimillion dollar police training centre in forest.

entries.title: Under pressure Liberia President George Weah to seek second term
entries.description: The former footballer, who took office in 2018, says he will pursue growth and peace if he wins another term in October.

entries.title: Why is Pope Francis visiting DRC and South Sudan?
entries.description: The head of the Catholic Church aims to help restore peace in two countries that have seen years of violence.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 342
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 342nd day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Making a point: Hong Kong journalists regroup abroad
entries.description: Journalists find it difficult to report in Hong Kong after imposition of national security law and crackdown on media.

entries.title: Burkina Faso says 28 soldiers, civilians killed in rebel attacks
entries.description: Rebel fighters conducted separate attacks on Sunday and Monday, including 15 men killed after a minibus was stopped.

entries.title: ‘Surprisingly resilient’: IMF lifts global growth forecasts
entries.description: Fund says demand in the US and Europe has been stronger than expected, and that only the UK faces a recession.

entries.title: Myanmar invited to Asian military meeting co-chaired by US
entries.description: Next month's meeting is focused on maritime security and will include exercises to tackle smuggling.

entries.title: ‘Pattern of repression’: US Democrats call to suspend Peru aid
entries.description: Democrats in the US House of Representatives issue a letter denouncing Peru's deadly crackdown against protesters.
